text: Convert the function into integral notation.

title: Convert Function to Integral Notation
text: Which of the following is the correct integral notation for $$f(x)=-3x^3+2x+2$$ over the interval [-2, 1]?

title: Apply the Integral of a Sum Property
text: $$\int_{a}^{b} f{\left(x\right)}+g{\left(x\right)} \,dx=\int_{a}^{b} f(x) \,dx+\int_{a}^{b} g(x) \,dx$$. In other words, the integral of a sum is the sum of the integrals. This means separating the terms into three different integrals.

title: Apply the Integral of the Product Property
text: $$\int_{a}^{b} c f{\left(x\right)} \,dx=c*\int_{a}^{b} f(x) \,dx$$ for constant c. In other words, the integral of the produce of a constant and a function is equal to the constant multiplied by the integral of the function. This means taking the constant outside and putting it in front of the integral.
